ai.summary: An 11.4 km section of the Capital Ring rated as moderate. The route combines urban parkland, city streets, and gentle trails, suitable for walkers with moderate fitness. Expect about 3–4 hours of hiking depending on pace.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily urban and park terrain: paved paths, compact gravel, and short grassy or dirt sections. Includes street crossings and well-maintained footpaths. Possible muddy patches after rain and some sections with urban noise; footing is generally even but varying surfaces can appear.
ai.safety_notes: Hike during daylight; be mindful of traffic when crossing roads and along busy urban stretches. Keep valuables secure in crowded areas. UK weather can change quickly—dress in layers and bring waterproofs. Carry a map or offline navigation, and notify someone of your plans if hiking alone. Watch for cyclists on shared paths and stay aware of surrounding pedestrians.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layers; hat and gloves if cold)
Map, guidebook, or offline navigation on a phone
Compact rain cover or pack liner
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn offer the most comfortable conditions; the hike is feasible year-round with proper clothing and daylight.

seo.title: Capital Ring Section 15 – 11.4 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Capital Ring Section 15, an 11.4 km moderate hike through UK urban parks and river routes. Practical tips, gear, and best seasons.
